result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Krause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew S. Krause in court, in custody with attorney John M Bliss.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 11:22 am.  State gives plea agreement plea to ct 1, ct's 2 - 4 DRI, withheld sentence 5 years probation, costs, No Restitution requested, State heard on credit, def. is in prison. Can be calculated at time of revocation.  Atty Bliss and def. agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charge and penalties.  Ct 1 Burglary, repeater, no contest plea, Ct's 2-4 DRI, Def. advised of constitutional right & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Atty Bliss is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily & given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Burglary, repeater in ct. 1.  State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Bliss gives sentencing recommendation. Recess @ 11:34 am. Reconvene @ 11:47 am.  Probation to be concurrent. State & Atty Bliss agree to 4 year prison 8 months serving, pending on programs.  Victim rights complied with. Def. has nothing to say.  Parties talk about earn release program, Def. will be in program in March. Court questions defendants work history. 
Court will approve agreement and orders on ct 1 - withheld sentence 5 years probation, concurrent with current sentence, Court is going to order fine of $250 plus  costs, $250 DNA Surcharge & DNA sample, already provided, No Restitution ordered.  Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. Withhold ruling on credit if revoked in future. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. No need to complete DNA Form. 
15-TR-930 - Commitment ordered. Court will reopen & withdraw commitement order. Def. to be put in p.p. will start when release from prison.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (Copy)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Matthew S. Krause in court with attorney John M Bliss.  Defendant Matthew S. Krause in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:23 p.m. Waiver of prelim filed. Court reviews waiver, finds knowing and voluntary. Probable cause and binds over. Information filed, copy received, reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all cts. Court receives pleas and directs entry. Counsel will contact JA to schedule. Court calls 11CF78 and 13CF160 @ 3:27. Same appearances. Revocation summary received, no additions or corrections. State heard on sentencing. Asks 11CF78 ct 1 5 1/2 yrs prison, 2 1/2 initial, 2 yrs ext supv, consecutive to 13CF160. Asks Court to follow Dept's recommendation on 13CF160 cts 8 & 9. Atty Bliss gives sentencing arguments, asks Court to adopt recommendation of Dept on 13CF160 cts 8 & 9 - 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv, concurrent to each other and concurrent to sentence serving on ct 7. Believes credit of 149 days on ct 8, 118 days credit on ct 9 and on 11CF78. State believes credit is 149 days and 119 days, Def stipulates. Def makes statement. Remarks by the Court. State has complied with victim's rights. 11CF78 - Court obligations converted to civil judgment. Ct 1 - 2 yrs prison, 1 yr initial, 1 yr ext supv., consecutive to sentence currently serving. 13CF160 cts 8 & 9, on each 2 yrs prison, 1 yr initial, 1 yr ext supv, consecutive to ct7 and to ct 1 in 11CF78. Def eligible for challenge inc. and earned release programs. 11CF78 credit for 119 days served. 13CF160 credit for 149 days on ct 8, 119 days o ct 9. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights. Statement by State regarding credit.  Court eliminates credit on 11CF78. Remarks by Counsel. State suggests on each ct 3 yrs 8 months, 1 yr 8 month initial, 2 yrs ext supv, all concurrent to each other and consecutive sentence currently serving on ct 7, with 30 days credit.  Atty Bliss agrees with this. Court will re-sentence on 11CF78 ct 1 3 yrs 8 months prison, 1 yr 8 mo initial, 2 yrs ext supv, no credit. Consecutive to 13CF160 ct 7.  13CF160 cts 8 & 9 - 3 yrs 8 mo prison, 1 yr 8 mo initial, 2 yrs ext supv, concurrent with each other and concurrent to 11CF78, consecutive to ct 7, credit for 30 days on ct 8. Eligible for challenge inc. and earned release.
ad prosequendum and order to institution
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
For The Production of Exculpatory Evidence - Defendant's
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant's

Defendant Matthew S. Krause in court via video,  with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Matthew S. Krause in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Motion to dismiss ct 2, arguments by Atty Schuster.  State moves to amend complaint to read weight and tested.  Motion withdrawn.  Def is on probation hold.  Time limits waived for preliminary.  Def agrees.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
